channel.title: American adventure
channel.description:
This series studies the values and characteristics of notable figures from America's early years. It is written by John M. Ehle and directed by John S. Clayton.,A study of man in the New World: his values and characteristics, who he is, what he lives by. The series is written by John M. Ehle and directed by John S. Clayton.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Appointment at Ford's Theatre
item.description: A radio play that dramatizes the last hours of Abraham Lincoln's life.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Theater & Drama

item.title: King with crown
item.description: A study of dignity and self-sacrifice, about a slave boy on a slave ship and the man who helps.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: United States--History--19th century

item.title: Unfound door
item.description: A study of the dedicated spirit. The story of novelist Thomas Wolfe as a young man.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Wolfe, Thomas, 1900-1938--Homes and haunts

item.title: Orchid
item.description: This program dramatizes an episode in the life of a young George Washington Carver.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: United States--History--19th century

item.title: Yankee loves a lady
item.description: A romance occurs between a Union solider and a Southern woman in the waning days of the Civil War.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: War & Civil Defense

item.title: Dial emergency
item.description: A study of neighborliness. The story of a young lady who must find her brother "somewhere in Maryland," and the people who help her.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Theater & Drama

item.title: Grandfather Jefferson
item.description: A study of a grandfather's love for his grandchildren. The story of the latter days of Jefferson.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Theater & Drama

item.title: Runaway justice
item.description: The story of John Williams, a man who aided fugitive slaves in North Carolina.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Zenger trial
item.description: The landmark 1733 trial of John Zenger is dramatized. The Zenger Trial helped to establish freedom of the press in the American colonies, affirming that truth is a defense against charges of libel.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Zenger, John Peter, 1697-1746

item.title: Free man
item.description: The story of Joseph Palmer, a 19th century American who refused to pay a fine for keeping facial hair and was imprisoned as a result. On principle, Palmer remained in prison until he was finally released more than a year later.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: Grenade
item.description: A study of an aspect of basic patriotism. The story of an African-American soldier in the first World War who has no stock reasons for fighting.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918

item.title: Free man
item.description: The story of Joseph Palmer, a 19th century American who refused to pay a fine for keeping facial hair and was imprisoned as a result. On principle, Palmer remained in prison until he was finally released more than a year later.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: United States--History--19th century

item.title: Rat on Lincoln Avenue
item.description: A study of some attitudes toward authority. The story of the death of an outlaw.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: U.S. History (1900-present)

item.title: Pioneer call
item.description: A study of the challenge of new frontiers. The story of a son who never can be satisfied.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Theater & Drama

item.title: Runaway justice
item.description: The story of John Williams, a man who aided fugitive slaves in North Carolina.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Resolute
item.description: A study of persistence in the face of repeated failure. The story of Cyrus Field, who on his fifth attempt lays the Atlantic cable.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Transatlantic cables--History

item.title: Federal lion
item.description: A dramatization of a situation where President Andrew Jackson was given a lion as a gift by the Emperor of Morocco.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: United States--History--19th century

item.title: Paint the big canvas
item.description: A study of visionary planning. The story of Pierre L'Enfant, designer of Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Washington (D.C.)

item.title: Unfound door
item.description: A study of the dedicated spirit. The story of novelist Thomas Wolfe as a young man.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Wolfe, Thomas, 1900-1938--Homes and haunts

item.title: Eccentric
item.description: A study of the eccentric in our society. The story of an outspoken philosophy professor.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Williams, Henry Horace, 1858-1940

item.title: Battle
item.description: This program dramatizes events surrounding the Battle of New Orleans at the end of the War of 1812.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: War of 1812

item.title: Resolute
item.description: A study of persistence in the face of repeated failure. The story of Cyrus Field, who on his fifth attempt lays the Atlantic cable.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Transatlantic cables--History

item.title: Johnny Appleseed
item.description: This radio play dramatizes the story of John Chapman, the American pioneer nurseryman better known as Johnny Appleseed.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: Federal lion
item.description: A dramatization of a situation where President Andrew Jackson was given a lion as a gift by the Emperor of Morocco.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: United States--History--19th century

item.title: Man of iron
item.description: The story of Ezra Lee, a man who piloted a primitive submarine during the American Revolution.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: War & Civil Defense

item.title: Hearthfire
item.description: A study of home and family, of a Tennessee family forced to leave the homestead when the Tennessee Valley Authority constructs Norris Dam.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: U.S. History (1900-present)

item.title: Builders on the river
item.description: In the thick of the Great Depression, a man takes on numerous obstacles in his quest to build a house.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Unemployment

item.title: Demagogue
item.description: Unlike other programs in this series, "The Demagogue." is purely fiction. It tells the story of a mudslinging political campaign, replete with aspersions of Communist sympathies.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Zenger trial
item.description: The landmark 1733 trial of John Zenger is dramatized. The Zenger Trial helped to establish freedom of the press in the American colonies, affirming that truth is a defense against charges of libel.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: Zenger, John Peter, 1697-1746

item.title: Leader of a dream
item.description: This program dramatizes the jailing of Archibald Murphey, a 19th century North Carolina politician.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.description: The story of Joseph Palmer, a 19th century American who refused to pay a fine for keeping facial hair and was imprisoned as a result. On principle, Palmer remained in prison until he was finally released more than a year later.

item.title: Judas tree
item.description: This program dramatizes events in Robert E. Lee's life during the Civil War.
item.dc:creator: Clayton, John S.
